document_data.name: Jelenn Urmbrusk
document_data.sex: Female<ref group="note">Jelenn is introduced as "she" and "her" on page 98 of ''[[Waterdeep: Dragon Heist]]'' but page 160 uses the male pronoun "he". This latter, minor reference is viewed as a typographical error.
document_data.mainbody: '''Jelenn Urmbrusk''' ({{Pronounce|juh|LEN|_|URM|brusk|refs=}}) was a moneylender and one of the [[Lords of Waterdeep]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality: Jelenn was a proud woman and she feared political scandals. If someone truly helped her, she could become a trusted ally, but anyone that tried to menace her attracted her wrath.
document_data.Activities: Jelenn was cloistered in her villa or attending her duties as Lord when she was not dealing with her creditors.
document_data.History:
In her work as a moneylender, Jelenn had some financial troubles and her customers abandoned her. In desperation and fearing a political scandal, she secretly asked for a large sum of money from the [[Zhentarim]].

In [[1492 DR]],{{WDH-time}} [[Manshoon]] blackmailed Jelenn and forced her to use her political power to cover the activities of the Zhentarim loyal to Manshoon.
